summary:
"One Thousand and One Nights" is a famous collection of Middle Eastern folk tales, often called "Arabian Nights" in English. These stories were gathered during the Islamic Golden Age and come from different parts of Asia and North Africa. Some are very old, with roots in ancient literature, while others are folk stories from the Abbasid and Mamluk periods.

The book's famous frame story tells of a king, Shahryar, who listens to tales told by his wife, Scheherazade, each night. This goes on for 1001 nights, with stories within stories, full of adventure, magic, and wisdom. Some well-known tales, like "Aladdin" and "Ali Baba," were added later by a French translator.
title: One Thousand and One Nights
